title: No need to fear this ‘dangerous’ insect
subtitle: A
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
shared over 30,000 times warns against stepping on a certain insect, or the entire sole of your foot will be punctured with holes.

The warning was posted by a user whose profile shows he is from Ilorin, the capital of Kwara state in western Nigeria. He claims the dangerous insect is “everywhere” in the country.

Pls [please], don't kill this insect wit [with] yr [your] foot. As u [you] can see from d [the] image. It is everywhere in the country. Don't ignore dis [this] message but share to save lives.”

are shown: a supposedly diseased foot and an odd-looking insect.

of the foot shows that it’s popped up on a number of places online. It’s included in images of

on different parts of the human body on

The image and others like it have been used a number of times in reference to trypophobia, the

Hoax is three years old

that used a photo of a supposedly diseased hand covered with holes on the palm. The fact-check traced the origin of the hoax to its appearance

, falsely claimed that the US Center for Disease Control website had said “the virus spreads to the place of the bodily contact and circulates the entire human system in minutes”.

can be created on different parts of the body by makeup artists.

The insect in the post has been identified as a male

carrying its eggs on its back.

that female giant water bugs lay their eggs on the back of the male, which carries them for protection until they hatch.

There is no evidence that the insect or its eggs can harm people.
